title: Shared Memory Archive
outcome: Shortly after the rise of decentralized governance, citizens across Stenograd begin receiving a mysterious invitation: anonymously submit your most significant memory tied to the BCI era. Over the next three weeks, memories—sorrowful, joyful, and confessional—are collected citywide and displayed in public forums by Council order. The collective archive of stories reframes Halden not as a tyrant or martyr but as a mirror, reflecting every citizen’s role in shaping the system. The Council, confronted with the city’s shared pain and potential for renewal, votes to dissolve itself and endorses citizen assemblies to guide Stenograd’s next phase. The last recorded memory becomes the foundation for a new civic pact.

events.description: Citizens receive citywide invitations to contribute their most important BCI-era memory. Council assures anonymity as collective memory project officially begins.
Hundreds of stories are published in community centers and forums, revealing overlooked injustices, lost opportunities, quiet acts of resistance, and surprising solidarity during the BCI years.
Families, old adversaries, and Council members gather as conflicting memories provoke hard conversations and public grief. The Halden-Index AI remains silent, observing.
Moved by the citywide reckoning, the Council votes to dissolve its authority and proposes interim citizen assemblies to shape new governance. All major decisions are suspended until assemblies form.
The most affecting memory—recounting both trust and betrayal—becomes the symbolic foundation for a new civic pact, marking the end of the Council era and the BCI’s legacy.
